PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask. where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name: NATHAN W. MEADOWS
Address: 928 SPRINGO CRES. S. SASKATOON
Birthplace: ENGLAND

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? ... 1912 ...
Where did you set up housekeeping? BALINORA, SASK ...
Where had you been living before that? A.D.A.N.A.C., R.R ...
For how many people did you prepare meals? ... S.F.F ...
How far was it to your nearest store? ... 1.8 MILES ...
How often could a visit be made to the store? ABOUT 6 TIMES MONTHLY
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Sugar, Salt, Syrup, Oatmeal.

Whole wheat flour? ... ............................................................

PIONEER DAYS: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our province.

Name: Nathan W. Medd
Address: 928 Spadina Cres. E.,
Saskatoon, Sask.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1912

Where had you been living before that? Adanac, R.R.

For how many people did you prepare meals? 5

How far was it to your nearest store? 18 miles

How often could a visit be made to the store? About once every two weeks

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Sugar, salt

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? In early days

In what quantities did you buy it? 20 lb.

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $4.00

How much did you use graham flour? Whole wheat flour?

Was flour milled locally? Yes, through the homestead

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $1.00

What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes

How did you grind it? With a hand mill
3. SUGAR AND SYRUP

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? 150 lb.

What was the price for a ten pound box of white sugar? about $6 each.

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? Lily White or Edward's.

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? 4 lb.

At what price?

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?

Butter? Creamed.

Eggs? None.

That was the price of butter? 15¢ per lb.

Did you keep eggs for inter? Yes.

Hot? Salt or water glass.

Did you make butter? Yes.

Churn? No.

What kind of churn?

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? Wild life, hogs, ducks, rabbits.

How did you get fresh meat? None.

How often did you get fresh meat? Twice a year.

How did you preserve meat? Dry salt.

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? Yes.

If so, what year was it organized? 1916.

Did you use game? Yes.

What kinds? Chicken, ducks.

For how long? Until about 1918.

What part did fish play in the family diet? Not much.

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? Fresh.

Kinds? Various.

About 1928, started using coal. More 1950, using oil.
